tool.name: Stanford Tokenizer v2.1.0
tool.help:
**What it does**
Splits text into simple tokens such as numbers, punctuation, and words using the `Stanford Tokenizer <https://nlp.stanford.edu/software/tokenizer.shtml>`_.
**Required annotations**
`Sentence <http://vocab.lappsgrid.org/Sentence.html>`_ annotations in LIF
.. class:: infomark
NOTE: This tokenizer also processes plain text in a LIF container with no Sentence annotations.
.. class:: infomark
**TIP**: If you want to input plain text and it is not not wrapped in a LIF container, use *Convert Formats->Wrap text*
**Generated Annotations**
A LIF document with a new view containing `Token <http://vocab.lappsgrid.org/Token.html>`_ annotations
